paper_abstract: The purpose of this paper is to provide an H control to avoid solving any Hamilton-Jacobi Inequalities (HJIs) for a class of single-input single-output (SISO) nonlinear stochastic systems. By transforming the stochastic system into an interconnected system with different structure case, the state feedback H. control problem is studied by using the almost disturbance decoupling technique, or gamma-dissipative theory. The H-infinity, controller is designed directly by solving a Lyapunov-like inequality or Stochastic Lur'e equations instead of HJIs.
paper_title: H-infinity CONTROLLER DESIGN FOR A CLASS OF SISO NONLINEAR STOCHASTIC SYSTEMS WITHOUT SOLVING HJIS
